title: How to Determine the Current Value of Your Fix-and-Flip Properties
excerpt: Accurately valuing your fix-and-flip properties is essential for maximizing profits and making smart investment decisions. Learn the top methods for determining current property value and when to use each approach.

content.text: Knowing the current value of your fix-and-flip properties is crucial for success. Accurate valuations help you set the right listing price, evaluate offers, adjust insurance, and plan your next move. Whether you’re prepping for resale or considering a refinance, understanding your property’s worth is key.
Three Main Ways to Value Your Flip

items: Market Approach: Compare your property to recent sales of similar homes (comps) in the area. Ideal for single-family flips and small multi-family projects.
Income Approach: Used mainly for larger multi-family or rental properties, this method values a property based on its income potential.
Cost Approach: Calculates value based on the cost to rebuild, minus depreciation. Useful for unique flips or new construction where comps are scarce.
Find 3-5 recent comps (sold in the last 3-6 months) similar in size, location, and condition. Use the MLS, Redfin, Zillow, or Realtor.com.
Adjust comp prices for differences (e.g., garage size, pool, upgrades).
Calculate price per square foot for each comp, average them, then multiply by your property’s square footage for an estimated value.

content.text: When to Use the Income or Cost Approach

items: Income Approach: For flips you plan to hold as rentals, subtract annual expenses from rental income to get Net Operating Income (NOI), then divide by the market cap rate.
Cost Approach: For new builds or unique rehabs, add the land value to the cost to rebuild (minus depreciation).

content.text: Get Professional Help: Agent, Broker, or Appraiser

items: Ask a real estate agent for a free Comparative Market Analysis (CMA) for an informal value estimate.
Order a Broker’s Opinion of Value (BOV) for a more detailed, affordable valuation—great for quick decisions or tax disputes.
Hire a licensed appraiser for the most accurate, lender-approved valuation—required for most refinances and some sales.

content.text: Fix-and-flip investing can be time-consuming. Consider partnering with experienced professionals who can help with valuations, comps, and market analysis—so you can focus on finding your next deal.
